intro: [WRONG START] Astilea bivittata, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of narrow, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Astelia bivittata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to moist, well-drained soils. It plays an important ecological role in New Zealand's native ecosystems.
